trans-unit.source: How to create APIs in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to create APIs in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create and configure APIs in Azure API Management.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create and configure APIs in Azure API Management.

trans-unit.source: How to create APIs in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to create APIs in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: An API in API Management represents a set of operations that can be invoked by client applications.
trans-unit.target: An API in API Management represents a set of operations that can be invoked by client applications.

trans-unit.source: New APIs are created in the publisher portal, and then the desired operations are added.
trans-unit.target: New APIs are created in the publisher portal, and then the desired operations are added.

trans-unit.source: Once the operations are added, the API is added to a product and can be published.
trans-unit.target: Once the operations are added, the API is added to a product and can be published.

trans-unit.source: Once an API is published, it can be used by subscribed to and used by developers.
trans-unit.target: Once an API is published, it can be used by subscribed to and used by developers.

trans-unit.source: This guide shows the first step in the process: how to create and configure a new API in API Management.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows the first step in the process: how to create and configure a new API in API Management.

trans-unit.source: For more information on adding operations and publishing a product, see [How to add operations to an API][] and [How to create and publish a product][].
trans-unit.target: For more information on adding operations and publishing a product, see [How to add operations to an API][] and [How to create and publish a product][].

trans-unit.source: Create a new API
trans-unit.target: Create a new API

trans-unit.source: APIs are created and configured in the publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: APIs are created and configured in the publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: To access the publisher portal, click **Manage** in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To access the publisher portal, click **Manage** in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: Publisher portal
trans-unit.target: Publisher portal

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see [Create an API Management service instance][] in the [Get started with Azure API Management][] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see [Create an API Management service instance][] in the [Get started with Azure API Management][] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Click **APIs** from the **API Management** menu on the left, and then click **add API**.
trans-unit.target: Click **APIs** from the **API Management** menu on the left, and then click **add API**.

trans-unit.source: Create API
trans-unit.target: Create API

trans-unit.source: Use the **Add new API** window to configure the new API.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Add new API** window to configure the new API.

trans-unit.source: Add new API
trans-unit.target: Add new API

trans-unit.source: The following three fields are used to configure the new API.
trans-unit.target: The following three fields are used to configure the new API.

trans-unit.source: **Web API title** provides a unique and descriptive name for the API.
trans-unit.target: **Web API title** provides a unique and descriptive name for the API.

trans-unit.source: It is displayed in the developer and management portals.
trans-unit.target: It is displayed in the developer and management portals.

trans-unit.source: **Web service URL** references the HTTP service implementing the API.
trans-unit.target: **Web service URL** references the HTTP service implementing the API.

trans-unit.source: API management forwards requests to this address.
trans-unit.target: API management forwards requests to this address.

trans-unit.source: **Web API URL suffix** is appended to the base URL for the API management service.
trans-unit.target: **Web API URL suffix** is appended to the base URL for the API management service.

trans-unit.source: The base URL is common for all APIs hosted by an API Management service instance.
trans-unit.target: The base URL is common for all APIs hosted by an API Management service instance.

trans-unit.source: API Management distinguishes APIs by their suffix and therefore the suffix must be unique for every API for a given publisher.
trans-unit.target: API Management distinguishes APIs by their suffix and therefore the suffix must be unique for every API for a given publisher.

trans-unit.source: **Web API URL scheme** determines which protocols can be used to access the API.
trans-unit.target: **Web API URL scheme** determines which protocols can be used to access the API.

trans-unit.source: HTTPs is specified by default.
trans-unit.target: HTTPs is specified by default.

trans-unit.source: Once the three values are configured, click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Once the three values are configured, click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Once the new API is created, the summary page for the API is displayed in the management portal.
trans-unit.target: Once the new API is created, the summary page for the API is displayed in the management portal.

trans-unit.source: API summary
trans-unit.target: API summary

trans-unit.source: Configure API settings
trans-unit.target: Configure API settings

trans-unit.source: You can use the **Settings** tab to verify and edit the configuration for an API.
trans-unit.target: You can use the **Settings** tab to verify and edit the configuration for an API.

trans-unit.source: **Web API title**, **Web service URL**, and **Web API URL suffix** are initially set when the API is created and can be modified here.
trans-unit.target: **Web API title**, **Web service URL**, and **Web API URL suffix** are initially set when the API is created and can be modified here.

trans-unit.source: **Description** provides an optional description, and **Web API URL scheme** determines which protocols can be used to access the API.
trans-unit.target: **Description** provides an optional description, and **Web API URL scheme** determines which protocols can be used to access the API.

trans-unit.source: API settings
trans-unit.target: API settings

trans-unit.source: To configure **Proxy authentication** for the web service implementing the API, select the **Security** tab.
trans-unit.target: To configure **Proxy authentication** for the web service implementing the API, select the **Security** tab.

trans-unit.source: The **With credentials** drop-down can be used to configure **Basic authentication** or **Mutual certificates** authentication.
trans-unit.target: The **With credentials** drop-down can be used to configure **Basic authentication** or **Mutual certificates** authentication.

trans-unit.source: To use basic authentication, simply enter the desired credentials.
trans-unit.target: To use basic authentication, simply enter the desired credentials.

trans-unit.source: For information on using mutual certificate authentication, see [How to secure back-end services using mutual certificate authentication in Azure API Management][].
trans-unit.target: For information on using mutual certificate authentication, see [How to secure back-end services using mutual certificate authentication in Azure API Management][].

trans-unit.source: The **Security** tab can also be used to configure **User authorization** using OAuth 2.0.
trans-unit.target: The **Security** tab can also be used to configure **User authorization** using OAuth 2.0.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to authorize developer accounts using OAuth 2.0 in Azure API Management][].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to authorize developer accounts using OAuth 2.0 in Azure API Management][].

trans-unit.source: Basic authentication settings
trans-unit.target: Basic authentication settings

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** to save any changes you make to the API settings.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** to save any changes you make to the API settings.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Once an API is created and the settings configured, the next steps are to add the operations to the API, add the API to a product, and publish it so that it is available for developers.
trans-unit.target: Once an API is created and the settings configured, the next steps are to add the operations to the API, add the API to a product, and publish it so that it is available for developers.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following two guides.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following two guides.

trans-unit.source: How to add operations to an API
trans-unit.target: How to add operations to an API

trans-unit.source: How to create and publish a product
trans-unit.target: How to create and publish a product

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
